bookroom

Class Bookshelf

  • java.lang.Object
    • bookroom.Bookshelf

  • public class Bookshelf
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to represent a bookcase/bookshelf in Java, and provide various functions to work with it.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Cody

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Criteria criteria
      The general category by which the bookshelf is classified.
      private java.lang.String criteriaType
      The specific criteria by which the bookshelf is classified.
      private boolean[] fullShelves
      An array holding the information of whether or not a single shelf on a bookcase is full.
      private int numBooksOnShelves
      The total number of books on the bookcase.
      private int numOfShelves
      The number of individual shelves on the bookcase.
      private boolean restock
      Whether the bookshelf needs to be restocked.
      private java.util.List<java.util.ArrayList<Book>> shelves
      The shelves of the bookcase, represented as a List of ArrayLists of Books.

                 java.lang.String criteriaType,
                 Criteria criteria)
        Constructor for the Bookshelf class.
        Parameters:
        numOfShelves - The number of individual shelves on the bookcase.
        criteriaType - The specific metric to organize the bookshelf.
        criteria - The more general metric to organize the bookshelf.

                     throws InvalidNumberException

        Parameters:
        newNum - The new number of shelves.
        Throws:
        InvalidNumberException - If the number passed in is less than 0.

        Returns:

      • getNumBooksOnShelf

        public int getNumBooksOnShelf(int shelf)
                       throws InvalidNumberException
        Returns the number of books on a singular shelf.
        Parameters:
        shelf - The index of the shelf.
        Returns:
        The number of books.
        Throws:
        InvalidNumberException - If the index provided is out of range of the number of shelves.

      • getShelfIsFull

        public boolean getShelfIsFull(int shelf)
                       throws InvalidNumberException
        Returns whether the given shelf is marked as full.
        Parameters:
        shelf - The index of the shelf.
        Returns:
        Whether the shelf is full.
        Throws:
        InvalidNumberException - If the index provided is out of range of the number of shelves.

        Whether or not the bookcase needs to be restocked.

        public void setRestock()
        Sets whether the bookcase needs to be restocked.

      • toggleShelfFull

        public void toggleShelfFull(int shelf)
                     throws InvalidNumberException
        Toggles whether the given single shelf is full.
        Parameters:
        shelf - The index of the shelf.
        Throws:
        InvalidNumberException - If the index provided is out of range of the number of shelves.

      • getGrossRevenue

        public double getGrossRevenue()
        Returns the potential gross revenue of the books on the shelf.
        Returns:
        The potential gross revenue of the books on the shelf.

      • addBook

        public void addBook(Book book,
                    int shelf)
             throws AllShelvesAreFullException,
                    InvalidNumberException
        Adds the given book to the shelf specified by the index.
        Parameters:
        book - The book to be added.
        shelf - The index of the shelf to add the book to.
        Throws:
        AllShelvesAreFullException - If there isn't a valid shelf to place the book on.
        InvalidNumberException - If the index provided is out of range of the number of shelves.

      • removeBook

        public Book removeBook(long isb)
                throws BookDoesNotExistException
        Removes the book specified by the ISBN provided.
        Parameters:
        isb - The identifying number of the book to remove.
        Returns:
        The removed book.
        Throws:
        BookDoesNotExistException - If the provided ISBN doesn't correspond to any book on the bookcase.

      • findFirstInstanceOfBook

        public Book findFirstInstanceOfBook(long isb)
                             throws BookDoesNotExistException
        Returns the first instance of the book identified by the provided ISBN.
        Parameters:
        isb - The identifying number of the book to be found.
        Returns:
        The found book.
        Throws:
        BookDoesNotExistException - If the provided ISBN doesn't correspond to any book on the bookcase.

      • getShelfOfFirstBookInstance

        public int getShelfOfFirstBookInstance(long isb)
                                throws BookDoesNotExistException
        Returns the index of the shelf containing the first instance of the book corresponding to the provided ISBN.
        Parameters:
        isb - The identifying number of the book.
        Returns:
        The index of the shelf containing the book.
        Throws:
        BookDoesNotExistException - If the provided ISBN doesn't correspond to any book on the bookcase.

      • findAllWrongBooks

        public java.util.List<Book> findAllWrongBooks()
        Returns a list of all books on the bookcase that do not match the bookcase's criteria type.
        Returns:
        A list of all books on the bookcase that don't match.

      • getNumCopiesOfBook

        public int getNumCopiesOfBook(long isb)
        Returns the number of copies of the book corresponding to the provided ISBN on the bookcase.
        Parameters:
        isb - The identifying number of the book.
        Returns:
        The number of copies of the book.

      • sortSingularShelf

        public void sortSingularShelf(int shelf)
                       throws InvalidNumberException
        Sorts the single shelf corresponding to the provided index.
        Parameters:
        shelf - The index of the shelf to sort.
        Throws:
        InvalidNumberException - If the index provided is out of range of the number of shelves.

      • sortAllShelves

        public void sortAllShelves()
                    throws InvalidNumberException
        Sorts all shelves on the bookcase.
        Throws:
        InvalidNumberException - Neccessary because of how the function works, this function shouldn't actually throw this.

      • findPositionOfBook

        public int findPositionOfBook(Book book)
        Returns the position of the given book on the shelf.
        Parameters:
        book - The book to find the position of.
        Returns:
        The position of the book on the shelf as an index.
